intro: Icica bengalensis, commonly known as the Bengal icica, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. It thrives in moist, swampy environments and is often found in mangrove forests. Due to its ecological importance, it plays a vital role in maintaining the biodiversity of its habitat.
